abstract: Mary Norris, longtime copy editor at The New Yorker, chronicles her over 30-year career correcting and fine-tuning stories for the publication in her memoir Between You & Me: Confessions of a Comma Queen.
lead_paragraph: A copy editor at The New Yorker looks back at her unusual career in “Between You & Me,” which reflects on hyphens, commas, spelling and profanity in print.

headline.main: Mary Norris Muses on a Lifetime of Literary Vigilance in ‘Between You & Me’
headline.print_headline: Perusing a Lifetime of Literary Vigilance

snippet: A copy editor at The New Yorker looks back at her unusual career in “Between You & Me,” which reflects on hyphens, commas, spelling and profanity in print.
